str2: For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To be absent. From apo and eimi; to be away.
Body, flesh; the body of the Church. From sozo; the body, used in a very wide application, literally or figuratively.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: From para and eimi; to be near, i.e. At hand; neuter present participle time being, or property.

word: and I have already pronounced judgment
parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: Properly, to distinguish, i.e. Decide; by implication, to try, condemn, punish.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Thus, so, in this manner. Or (referring to what precedes or follows).

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Middle - Accusative Masculine Singular
str2: From kata and ergazomai; to work fully, i.e. Accomplish; by implication, to finish, fashion.
Probably adverb of comparative from hos; which how, i.e. In that manner.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: From para and eimi; to be near, i.e. At hand; neuter present participle time being, or property.
